title: Anger
verses: Proverbs 14:29 (WEB) — “He who is slow to anger has great understanding, but he who has a quick temper displays folly.”
James 1:19–20 (WEB) — “Let every person be swift to hear, slow to speak, and slow to anger; for the anger of man doesn’t produce the righteousness of God.”
Ephesians 4:26–27 (WEB) — “Be angry, and don’t sin… don’t let the sun go down on your wrath; neither give place to the devil.”
Proverbs 15:1 (WEB) — “A gentle answer turns away wrath, but a harsh word stirs up anger.”
body: Invite the Spirit to slow your reactions. Step back, breathe, and name what is threatened—your comfort, control, or reputation. Choose a gentle response, set wise boundaries, and pursue reconciliation where possible. Remember that human anger can’t achieve God’s righteousness.
prayer: Lord Jesus, meek and lowly in heart, calm my reactions. Put Your Spirit’s gentleness on my tongue and wisdom in my steps. Give me courage to apologize, to forgive, and to seek peace today. Amen.
